subject: Physical Fitness
title: Muscle Does Not Turn Into Fat
description: A quick, practical guide to Muscle Does Not Turn Into Fat.

hook.text: Stop lifting and your muscles turn to fat â€” or so the myth goes. It's biologically impossible.

buildup.text: Muscle cells and fat cells are completely different tissues. One cannot transform into the other.

discovery.text: What actually happens: inactive muscles shrink while excess calories get stored as new fat tissue.

twist.text: The illusion is convincing. You lose size in one place and gain it in another. But no conversion occurs.

climax.text: Maintaining some activity prevents muscle loss. Even minimal training preserves what you've built.

punchline.text: Muscle and fat are neighbors, not relatives. One can't become the other.
